On June 17-21, 2024, the WMiI will host the 8th Nonlinear Analysis Symposium, organized jointly with the J. P. Schauder University Center for Nonlinear Research (link: https://cbn.umk.pl/home).
Topics will focus mainly on the following areas: topological methods in differential equations, mathematical modeling in science and technology, variational methods and critical points, optimization and control, metric fixed point theory, partial differential equations and their applications, low-dimensional dynamics, topological invariants and their applications.
The following ceremonies will be held on Tuesday *18 June*:
* presentation of the J. P. Schauder Medal to *Professor* *Thomas Bartsch* of the University of Giessen,
* presentation of the J. P. Schauder Prize for young mathematicians to *dr. Bartosz Bieganowski* (UW, UMK) and honorable mentions in this competition to *dr. Wojciech Górny* (Universität Wien) and *dr. Jakub Skrzeczkowski* (Oxford University),

and on Thursday *June 20* there will be a special session dedicated to *prof. Wojciech Kryszewski*, a long-time employee of WMiI, a distinguished member of the CBN and a well-known specialist in topological methods in nonlinear analysis.
You are cordially invited!

For more information about the Symposium, please visit sna.mat.umk.pl (link: https://sna.mat.umk.pl/). The partners of the event are the University Center of Excellence DAMSI (link: https://damsi.umk.pl/), the European Mathematical Society (link: https://euromathsoc.org/) and the Faculty of Mathematics, Informatics and Mechanics of the UW (link: https://www.mimuw.edu.pl/pl/), as well as the City of Torun (link: https://www.torun.pl/), LOGI Publishing House (link: https://lamiglowki.net/) and Kopernik Sugar Factory S.A. (link: https://www.kopernik.com.pl/)

At the AAMAS 2024 conference (The 23rd International Conference on Autonomous Agents and Multi-Agent Systems) of rank A*, held in Auckland, New Zealand, on May 9, a team consisting of Damian Kurpiewski (IPI PAN, WMI UMK), Mateusz Kaminski (IPI PAN, WMI UMK) and Wojciech Jamroga (University of Luxembourg, IPI PAN) received the Best Demonstration Award for the paper "STV+KH: Towards Practical Verification of Strategic Ability for Knowledge and Information Flow." The research topic was to develop a strategic ability verification tool for ATL logic with incomplete information by adding verification of formulas with knowledge (K) and Hartley uncertainty (H) operators.

Link to publication: https://www.ifaamas.org/Proceedings/aamas2024/pdfs/p2812.pdf

The *Faculty of Mathematics and Computer Science at the University of Warsaw announces a competition for a PhD scholarship within the framework of the project "**Perturbations of locally Hamiltonian streams and generalized sectional translations**" headed by Prof. Krzysztof Frączek*.
*------------------------------------------------*

*Competition for PhD scholarship within the project "**Perturbations of locally Hamiltonian streams and generalized sectional translations**" funded by NCN*.

*Project title:* *Perturbations of locally Hamiltonian streams and generalized sectional translations*.

*Project director: prof. dr. hab. Krzysztof Frączek*.

*Unit name*: Department of Mathematics and Computer Science, Nicolaus Copernicus University in Toruń.

*Position name*: doctoral student.

*Requirements*:
- completed master's degree in mathematics (master's degree to be delivered by 10/09/2024),
- Research interests related to dynamical systems theory and ergodic theory,
- knowledge of the fundamentals of dynamical systems theory,
- fluency in English.

Required documents:
- Curriculum vitae including the course of study, achievements resulting from research, scholarships, awards, scientific experience gained at home or abroad (including participation in workshops, internships and research projects),
- a description of scientific achievements, including a list of publications and conference presentations,
- a letter of motivation including a description of scientific interests related to the topic of the project,
- copies of diplomas received to date,
- signed consent to the processing of personal data.

*Task description*:
- conducting scientific research as described in the project https://ncn.gov.pl/sites/default/files/listy-rankingowe/2023-10-12-prbis9kij4c/streszczenia/595675-en.pdf,
- completing training at a doctoral school,
- preparing a doctoral dissertation,
- implementation of an internship in a foreign unit,
- Active participation in research group meetings to the extent agreed with the project manager,
- cooperation in the dissemination of project results, including involvement in the preparation of publications and presentations.

*Type of NCN competition*: PRELUDE BIS - ST

*Date for submission of bids*: May 31, 2024

*Form of bid submission*: email

*Conditions of Employment*:
The doctoral stipend will be awarded for a period of 48 months from October 1, 2024 in the monthly amount of: PLN 5 thousand until the month in which the doctoral student's mid-term evaluation at the doctoral school is conducted, and PLN 6 thousand in the following period. As part of participation in the project, a doctoral student may apply for funding for short research or training trips and participation in conferences.

*Additional information*:
Documents should be sent electronically to: fraczek@mat.umk.pl

page_content: The next edition of the "Interdepartmental Team Project Competition" is launched!!! The competition is conducted as part of the "Team Project Workshop" course at the Faculty of Physics, Astronomy and Applied Informatics (WFAiIS) taught in the Applied Informatics major and the "Team Programming" course at the Faculty of Mathematics and Informatics (WMiI) taught in the Computer Science major. The Competition is co-organized by the Alexander Jablonski Foundation. The competition is under the Honorary Patronage of the Vice-Rector for Student Affairs, Prof. Beata Przyborowska, PhD. Participation in the Competition consists of preparing a project, submitting it to the Competition and giving a 20-minute oral presentation devoted to it, which is evaluated by the Committee. The Competition awards cash prizes sponsored by sponsors: EIB, AIS.PL and Simplito. For more details and rules and regulations, visit.

On Wednesday *8 May 2024* at *18:00* in room *S9*, the seventh meeting of the *meetit.live* series will be held in the 2023/24 academic year. The speaker will be Mr. *Jakub Chilchuk*, who will give a lecture entitled. , ''*Validation? And who needs it*''. The meeting is open to all interested, but for organizational reasons, please register through the website: https://app.evenea.pl/event/meetitlive-14/. After the lecture, participants are invited to an integration meeting over coffee and pastries.

Lecture topics:

During the lecture, we will not go into details of how each tool we use at Intel works. Instead, we'll focus on what validation is for, why it's not at all this "inferior" career path, why validation does not equal testing and who can make a career in validation. We will talk about several cases where validation was lacking and what the consequences were. I will talk about validation mainly from the perspective of Intel products and cyber security, but there will be examples from other fields.

About the speaker:

Jakub Chilczuk - has been working at Intel for over 2 years, breaking things and pointing out bugs to developers. He currently works with Intel Xeon processors and previously with Intel Optane. Privately interested in and active with cyber security.

About the company:

Intel Corporation - an American multinational corporation and technology company headquartered in Santa Clara, California, incorporated in the state of Delaware. Intel is one of the world's largest semiconductor chip manufacturers by revenue. Intel is not only processors, but also, for example, graphics cards, networking. It offers its employees fruit in the office all week, not just on Thursdays.

meetit.live are cyclical events in the form of evening lectures covering topics related to those undertaken at the UMK Department of Mathematics and Computer Science in all areas of study. We plan to meet every second Wednesday of the month. We hope that these meetings will provide an opportunity to get to know each other and integrate community members and supporters of our faculty. For more information, visit: https://meetit.live.

On April 21 at WMiI, we invite you to the block of events "Open Mind - Science to the Square" during the 22nd Toruń Festival of Science and Arts! Here are the events at our Faculty:

* Science Picnic: from 9:30 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. whole families can immerse themselves in the world of mathematical fun, games and puzzles.
* Exhibition of computer projects: from 9:30 am to 2:30 pm come and enter the world of electronics, computers and software. See the projects created at WMiI!
* Games with prizes: escape room (for sign-ups), dice championship (for sign-ups) and a field game around the Faculty building (from 9:30 am to 2:30 pm).
* Lectures:
	* 10:00-11:15 What don't mathematicians know?
	* 11:30-12:45, What do Titanic survivors, Tiffany diamonds and 1970s American cars have in common? About open datasets.
	* 13:00 - 14:15, Open source: transforming the digital future.

You can find the full festival program at www.festiwal.torun.pl (link: http://www.festiwal.torun.pl), and learn about our events by clicking on the link https://tiny.pl/dr5z3

*** Online Polish-Ukrainian dictionary of school mathematical concepts / польсько-український інтернет-словних шкільних математичних термінів. ***

Ця ініціатива є реакцією на проблеми під час використаня популярних інтернет-додатків для перекладу, оскільки вони часто роблять помилки у перекладі математичної термінології. Перша версія словника доступна за адресою: https://ua.mat.umk.pl/
The initiative is a response to the difficulties accompanying the use of popular online translation applications, as they often make mistakes when dealing with specialized terms. The first version of the dictionary is available at: https://ua.mat.umk.pl/

*** Recruitment/набір ***

Ви можете вивчати математику або інформатику на факультеті математики та інформатики Університету Миколи Коперника в Торуні! Набір триває. Студенти, які переїжджають з українських вищих навчальних закладів, можуть зареєструватися навчання до Університету Миколая Коперника в Торуні. Пропозиція стосується лише студентів українських вищих навчальних закладів, які були змушені покинути свою країну внаслідок початку війни. Навчання на факультеті математики та інформатики ведеться польською мовою. Зареєструватися можна тут: https://irk.umk.pl/pl/offer/PUA2021/

You can study mathematics or computer science at the Faculty of Mathematics and Computer Science of Nicolaus Copernicus University in Torun! Recruitment is ongoing. Those transferring from Ukrainian universities can register to study at the Nicolaus Copernicus University in Torun. The offer is addressed exclusively to Ukrainian university students who were forced to leave their country due to the outbreak of war. Studies at the Faculty of Mathematics and Computer Science are conducted in Polish. You can register here: https://irk.umk.pl/pl/offer/PUA2021/
